com.revature.controllers

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.controllers.UserController

  • @RestController
 @CrossOrigin
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is our controller that handles all request concerning User request and functions. It is a part of the MVC architecture implementation allowing the servlet mapping to be abstracted away from the programmer.
    Author:
    jeremiah

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserController()
      Instantiates a new user controller.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String createUser(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String pswd)
      This method will create a new user in the database using parameters passed to it in a body of a post request.
      static boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String userName)
      This method will delete the user associated with the username passed to it in a request body.
      static java.util.List<RUser> getAllChefs()
      To get all Users with Chef status simply call this method with getChefs appended to the url.
      static java.util.List<RUser> getAllDefaultUsers()
      This method will return all default users in the database.
      static java.util.List<RUser> getAllUsers()
      This controller method returns all users in the database as a JSON object to be handled by the view in our component.ts
      static RUser getUserByUsername(java.lang.String username)
      This controller returns to the frontend a user whose username matches the path variable passed in the url .
      static java.util.List<RUser> getUsernames()
      This controller method returns all usernames in the database as a JSON object to be handled by the view in our component.ts it is intended to be used to provide a more reactive way to confirm the availability of a username when a user is creating a profile.
      static RUser updateProfile(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String userName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String pswd)
      This method will update the user attached to the userId passed in the request body using the other parameters passed.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllUsers

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                produces="application/json",
                value="/getUsers")
public static java.util.List<RUser> getAllUsers()
        This controller method returns all users in the database as a JSON object to be handled by the view in our component.ts
        Returns:
        array of JSON objects(as a string) containing user objects

      • getUserByUsername

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                produces="application/json",
                value="/getUsers/{username}")
public static RUser getUserByUsername(@PathVariable(value="username")
                                                                                                                                                                java.lang.String username)
        This controller returns to the frontend a user whose username matches the path variable passed in the url .
        Parameters:
        username - the username
        Returns:
        RUser object matching the username

      • getUsernames

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                produces="application/json",
                value="/getUsernames")
public static java.util.List<RUser> getUsernames()
        This controller method returns all usernames in the database as a JSON object to be handled by the view in our component.ts it is intended to be used to provide a more reactive way to confirm the availability of a username when a user is creating a profile.
        Returns:
        array containing all usernames in database

      • getAllChefs

        @RequestMapping(method=GET,
                produces="application/json",
                value="/getChefs")
public static java.util.List<RUser> getAllChefs()
        To get all Users with Chef status simply call this method with getChefs appended to the url.
        Returns:
        array of JSON objects(as a string) containing chef user objects

      • getAllDefaultUsers

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                produces="application/json",
                value="/getDefaultUsers")
public static java.util.List<RUser> getAllDefaultUsers()
        This method will return all default users in the database.
        Returns:
        array of JSON objects(as a string) containing default user objects

      • createUser

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/newUser")
public static java.lang.String createUser(@RequestParam(value="name")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String name,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(value="userName")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String userName,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(value="email")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String email,
                                                                                                           @RequestParam(value="pswd")
                                                                                                           java.lang.String pswd)
        This method will create a new user in the database using parameters passed to it in a body of a post request.
        Parameters:
        name - the name
        userName - the user name
        email - the email
        pswd - the pswd
        Returns:
        a message detailing the results of the create action

      • updateProfile

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/updateUser")
public static RUser updateProfile(@RequestParam(value="userId")
                                                                                                      java.lang.String id,
                                                                                                      @RequestParam(value="name")
                                                                                                      java.lang.String name,
                                                                                                      @RequestParam(value="userName")
                                                                                                      java.lang.String userName,
                                                                                                      @RequestParam(value="email")
                                                                                                      java.lang.String email,
                                                                                                      @RequestParam(value="pswd")
                                                                                                      java.lang.String pswd)
        This method will update the user attached to the userId passed in the request body using the other parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        id - the id
        name - the name
        userName - the user name
        email - the email
        pswd - the pswd
        Returns:
        the updated user object

      • deleteUser

        @RequestMapping(method=POST,
                value="/deleteUser")
public static boolean deleteUser(@RequestParam(value="userName")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String userName)
        This method will delete the user associated with the username passed to it in a request body.
        Parameters:
        userName - the user name
        Returns:
        boolean indicating status of the deletion
